verb.description: Walk or behave in a very confident and typically arrogant or aggressive way.

noun.description: A very confident and typically arrogant or aggressive gait or manner.
examples: they strolled around the camp with an exaggerated swagger

adjective.description: Denoting a coat or jacket cut with a loose flare from the shoulders.

origin: Early 16th century: apparently a frequentative of the verb swag.
